Creation, initialization and destruction of jmi_t structs
[The JMI Model interface]

The main data structure in the JMI Model interface is jmi_t, which contains all information needed to evaluate the functions in the JMI Model interface. More...

Detailed Description

The main data structure in the JMI Model interface is jmi_t, which contains all information needed to evaluate the functions in the JMI Model interface.

Typically, a pointer to a jmi_t struct is passed as the first argument to functions in the interface.

Function Documentation

int jmi_new ( jmi_t **  jmi  ) 

Create a new jmi_t struct.

This function creates a new jmi struct, for which a pointer is returned in the output argument jmi.

Typically this function is defined in the generated code.

Parameters:
jmi A pointer to a jmi_t pointer where the new jmi_t struct is stored.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_ad_init ( jmi_t *  jmi  ) 

Initializes the AD variables and tapes.

Prior to this call, the variables in z should be initialized, which is also the reason why this function must be provided for the user to call after the actual creation of the jmi_t struct.

Parameters:
jmi A pointer to a jmi_t struct.
Returns:
Error code.

int jmi_delete ( jmi_t *  jmi  ) 

Deallocates memory and deletes a jmi_t struct.

Parameters:
jmi A pointer to the jmi_t struc to be deleted.
